issue.title: check blockpage fingerprints in file order
issue.body:
This doesn't solve the whole problem with multiple blockpages matching, but it does make the blockpage matching deterministic (before it could depend on internal details of how python dictionaries are ordered)

Also added some mypy fixes to resolve git build issues that came from mypy upgrading to .9.0.0

issue.title: Unable to install missing types
issue.body:
<!--
  If you're new to mypy and you're not sure whether what you're experiencing is a mypy bug, please see the "Question and Help" form
  instead.
-->

**Bug Report**

<!--
Note: If the problem you are reporting is about a specific library function, then the typeshed tracker is better suited
for this report: https://github.com/python/typeshed/issues
-->

Mypy segfaults on installation of missing types.

**To Reproduce**

1. mypy project
2. mypy  --install-types

**Expected Behavior**

<!--
  How did you expect your project to behave?
  It’s fine if you’re not sure your understanding is correct.
  Write down what you thought would happen. If you just expected no errors, you can delete this section.
-->

Mypy would install the missing library stubs.

**Actual Behavior**

<!--
  Did something go wrong?
  Is something broken, or not behaving as you expected?
-->

Mypy reports segmentation fault with no traceback (even with --tb on).
**Your Environment**

<!-- Include as many relevant details about the environment you experienced the bug in -->

- Mypy version used: 0.900
- Mypy command-line flags: none
- Mypy configuration options from `mypy.ini` (and other config files):
```
check_untyped_defs = true                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 
ignore_missing_imports = true   
```
- Python version used: 3.8.6 (pyenv, tox), 3.9.0 (system)
- Operating system and version: Debian
<!--
You can freely edit this text, please remove all the lines
you believe are unnecessary.
-->

body:
This seem to be a problem with the binary wheels. As a workaround, you can uninstall mypy and reinstall without the binaries:

```
python3 -m pip install --no-binary :all: mypy
```

**EDIT**: See comment below for a better way to do it (replace `:all:` with `mypy`).

However, this results in much worse performance. We'll need a 0.901 hotfix release.

Note that most people probably want `--no-binary=mypy` because they *do* want `typed_ast`, `lxml`, and others to use pre-compiled binaries. So I'd recommend

```
python3 -m pip install --no-binary=mypy mypy
```

issue.title: CI: mypy: Fix missing stubs for third-party libs

repository.name: BlueOS
repository.description: The open source platform for ROV, USV, robotic system operation, development, and expansion.

issue.body:
Mypy doesn't install stubs for third-party libraries anymore by default, like explained on the following article:

https://mypy-lang.blogspot.com/2021/05/the-upcoming-switch-to-modular-typeshed.html

Fix #315

issue.title: `--install-types` not recognized
issue.body:
**Bug Report**

`mypy --install-types` (as recommended [in the docs](https://mypy.readthedocs.io/en/latest/running_mypy.html#missing-imports)) produces `mypy: error: unrecognized arguments: --install-types`. I suspect this might be a leftover in the documentation.

**Your Environment**

- Mypy version used: 0.770
- Mypy command-line flags:
- Mypy configuration options from `mypy.ini` (and other config files):
- Python version used: Python 3.7.5
- Operating system and version: Ubuntu 19.10

issue.title: [mypyc] Fix evaluation of iterable in list comprehension twice
issue.body:
This could result in a crash if the second evaluation results
in a shorter list, such as in this example (besides being incorrect
overall):

```
a = [s for s in f.readlines()]
```

`f.readlines()` was called twice, resulting in an empty list on
the second call. This caused the list object constructed in the
comprehension to have a NULL item, which is invalid.

This fixes `mypy --install-types` in compiled mode.

Fixes #10596.

labels.name: cla: yes
labels.description: This human has signed the Contributor License Agreement.

repository.name: gapic-generator-python
repository.description: Generate Python API client libraries from Protocol Buffers.

body: I just released mypy 0.901 that includes a fix to this issue.

issue.title: Release 0.900 planning
issue.body:
I'm planning to release mypy 0.900 some time in March. This release will have a particularly significant change, as third-party stubs are no longer shipped with mypy. They need to be installed by installing suitable stub packages. For example, `pip install types-requests` installs the stubs for Requests. Mypy will suggest the names of stub packages to install, and `mypy --install-types` will automatically install the suggested stub packages (this doesn't work with the mypy daemon, however).

Since this change is potentially quite disruptive, I'm announcing the release here well ahead of the target release date.

The unbundling of typeshed is already implemented in GitHub master, so it's possible to start testing this right now. If you can, please try using a development version and report how it went. You can find pre-built wheels here:

https://github.com/mypyc/mypy_mypyc-wheels/releases

I'll probably cut the release branch around mid-March (but this is still very tentative).

body: @JukkaL, I can confirm this solves my problem. Thank you so much for the quick fix!

issue.title: Only issue a single signature after retirement transaction
issue.body:
The goal of this change is to make it so that the retirement transaction for a node is at most followed by a single signature from that node (if it is primary), but no more. This is to facilitate audit, it isn't a security change, since the primary is still ordering transactions of course.

In practice, it means expanding the consensus state machine somewhat, with two new states:

Retiring 1: entered when `retirement_idx` is set to the index of the retirement transaction
Retiring 2: entered when `retirement_committable_idx` is set to the index of the first signature following `retirement_idx`

Additionally, the following transitions are possible:

Retiring 1 -> Follower, on `rollback()`
Retiring 2 -> Follower, on `rollback()`
Retiring 2 -> Retired, on `commit_idx` moving past `retirement_committable_idx`

Note that Retiring 2 -> Retiring 1 is never possible, since a rollback that removes `retirement_committable_idx` necessarily removes `retirement_idx` as well.

In terms of behaviour, Retiring 1 doesn't affect a Leader or Follower. When entering Retiring 2 however, Leaders will stop replicating anything higher than `retirement_committable_idx`, and followers will similarly reject append entries higher than `retirement_committable_idx`.

When transitioning to `Retired`, Leaders will also stop sending heartbeats.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4016369/121199113-92357e80-c86a-11eb-90a5-6793d01271c1.png)

TODO:

- [x] Document state machine
- [x] Rename `become_follower()`
- [x] Add `can_replicate()` and have frontend use that rather than `is_primary()` to decide if it can handle write transactions.
- [x] Add audit test to check number of post-retirement signatures

issue.title: Initial support for enabling MyPy in CI

repository.name: tvm
repository.description: Open deep learning compiler stack for cpu, gpu and specialized accelerators

issue.body:
This PR adds initial support for `MyPy` in the Jenkins pipeline.
At this point, it checks only `python/tvm/runtime` and `python/tvm/auto_scheduler`.

1) It adds check with `MyPy` in linting stage,
2) It add an option in `Makefile` for `$ make mypy`.

@jroesch @jwfromm
